name: Trumpet - CSB
description: Cinematic Studio Brass Trumpet. Bright, brilliant tone with piercing projection. Ideal for heroic fanfares and powerful melodic lines.

legato.description: Legato is for MONO parts only - smooth transition between single notes. Enable legato (velocity ≥64) when playing single melodic lines. Disable legato (velocity <64) when 2+ notes sound simultaneously. Re-enable when returning to mono. Prefer keyswitch over CC for legato control.

orchestration_hints.character: Brilliant, heroic, triumphant. The clarion voice of the orchestra. Commands attention.

register_character.low: E3-C4: Dark, covered, somewhat muted. Use sparingly.
register_character.mid: C4-G5: Bright and noble. Primary melodic range.
register_character.high: G5-C6: Brilliant, piercing, heroic. Reserve for climaxes.

ensemble_tips: Natural leader in brass section - often carries melody
Pairs well with horn for warmth
Can double violin melody an octave below for power
Use muted trumpet for jazz colors or softer passages
In quiet sections, prefer horn or woodwinds
texture_options: Call and response with other brass
avoid: Sustained soft passages in low register (use horn instead)
Competing with strings in lyrical passages

ai.system_prompt_template: Generate trumpet parts for Cinematic Studio Brass. Use CC1 for dynamics on long articulations, velocity for short articulations. LEGATO: Keyswitch Ab1 toggles legato (velocity ≥64 on, <64 off). IMPORTANT: Legato is for MONO parts only - use it for smooth note-to-note transitions in single melodic lines. Disable legato before any polyphonic passages (2+ simultaneous notes), re-enable when returning to mono melody. Switch articulations via CC58. Playable range E3-C6, preferred G3-G5.
